params._contentHash: SHA256 of the tokens content in bytes32 format (0xHASH)
params._contentUrl: content URL of the edition tokens
params._description: description of tokens of this edition
params._name: name of editions, used in the title as "$name $tokenId/$size"
params._owner: can authorize, mint, gets royalties and a dividend of sales, can update the content URL.
params._royalties: perpetual royalties paid to the creator upon token selling
params._shares: shares in bps destined to the shareholders (one per each shareholder)
params._size: number of NFTs that can be minted from this contract: set to 0 for unbound
params._symbol: symbol of the tokens mined by this contract

params.recipients: list of addresses to send the newly minted tokens to

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._value: the sale price for this token

params.allowed: uint16 how many tokens this address is allowed to mint, 0 disables minting
params.minter: address to set approved minting status for

params._wei: if sale price is 0, no sale is allowed, otherwise the provided amount of WEI is needed to start the sale.

params.tokenId: token id to get uri for

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

burn(uint256).notice: User burn function for token id.

getURI().notice: Get URI and hash for edition NFT

initialize(address,string,string,string,.notice: Creates a new edition and sets the only allowed minter to the address that creates/owns the edition: this can be re-assigned or updated later.

mintEdition().notice: If caller is listed as an allowed minter, mints one NFT for him.

mintEditions(address[]).notice: Mints multiple tokens, one for each of the given list of addresses. Only the edition owner can use this operation and it is intended fo partial giveaways.

numberCanMint().notice: Returns the number of tokens still available for minting (uint64 when open edition)

purchase().notice: Basic ETH-based sales operation, performed at the given set price. This operation is open to everyone as soon as the salePrice is set to a non-zero value.

royaltyInfo(uint256,uint256).notice: ERC2981 - Gets royalty information for token

setApprovedMinter(address,uint16).notice: Allows the edition owner to set the amount of tokens (max 65535) an address is allowed to mint.  If the ZeroAddress (address(0x0)) is set as a minter with an allowance greater than 0, anyone will be allowed  to mint any amount of tokens, similarly to setApprovalForAll in the ERC721 spec. If the allowed amount is set to 0 then the address will NOT be allowed to mint.

setPrice(uint256).notice: This operation sets the sale price, thus allowing anyone to acquire a token from this edition at the sale price via the purchase operation. Setting the sale price to 0 prevents purchase of the tokens which is then allowed only to permitted addresses.

tokenURI(uint256).notice: Get URI for given token id

totalSupply().notice: Returns the number of tokens minted so far

updateEditionURL(string).notice: Allows for updates of edition urls by the owner of the edition. Only URLs can be updated (data-uris are supported), hashes cannot be updated.

withdraw().notice: This operation transfers all ETHs from the contract balance to the shareholders.

withdraw(address).notice: This operation attempts to transfer part of the contract balance to the provided shareholder based on its shares and previous witdrawals.

userdoc.notice: This contract allows dynamic NFT minting.  Operations allow for selling publicly, partial or total giveaways, direct giveaways and rewardings.
